id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group.
id.notes: All id data elements are shown as required so that that every data group can be explicitly identified. Almost no other data elements are shown as required but they may be required by specific rulesets.

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

data_timestamp.description: Date and time of data publication
data_timestamp.notes: Date and time of publication of the data

data_version.description: Integer version identifier for the data
data_version.notes: Used by data publisher to track revisions of the data and shall be incremented for each data revision

ruleset_model_descriptions.description: A list of the ruleset model descriptions within the project each with a unique ruleset_model_type.
ruleset_model_descriptions.notes: For submissions with ruleset model descriptions (i.e., user, proposed, baseline,..) generated as separate files, only one model description would be defined for each ASHRAE229 ruleset project description json file. For submissions where the software always produces all ruleset model descriptions together, multiple model descriptions would appear in the same ASHRAE229 ruleset project description json file. Some rulesets may restrict the submission process including the number of files and number of model descriptions per file. Multiple model descriptions may be required by rulesets that require models at various tiers or levels of performance. Model descriptions may also be used by References between data groups and are restricted to be within the same ruleset model description. For 90.1-2019 appendix G model descriptions would be created for the following models: user, proposed, baseline at 0 degrees, baseline at 90 degrees, baseline at 180 degrees, and baseline at 270 degrees. All IDs within a ruleset model description should be unique for each type of data group. Between ruleset model descriptions, IDs should be the same for the same component. For example, a Surface with an ID of LobbyFrontSurface is very likely to have the same geometry for all ruleset model descriptions except perhaps the azimuth so that surface should have the ID LobbyFrontSurface for all ruleset model descriptions.

calendar.description: Information on the calendar used with the simulation.

weather.description: Information on the local weather conditions used with the simulation.

compliance_path.description: Indicates the chosen compliance path if the ruleset has multiple compliance paths such as 90.1 Appendix G has code compliance and beyond code

output_format_type.description: Indicates the chosen format for output

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

type.description: Describes the current ruleset model description for rulesets with multiple simulation models
type.notes: Will usually designate which simulation this RulesetModelDescription refers to such as: PROPOSED, BASELINE_0, USER, RATED, REFERENCE

transformers.description: Electrical transformers at the building site
transformers.notes: Contains a list of transformers that convert electricity from a higher voltage to one used by the building, exterior lighting, and other services at the site.

buildings.notes: Contains a list of buildings on the site (often just one).

schedules.description: Schedules for internal loads, thermostats, equipment operation and control, and any other need.
schedules.notes: Contains a list of schedules used in model.

measured_infiltration_pressure_differenc.description: Differential pressure difference used during measurement for infiltration values.
measured_infiltration_pressure_differenc.notes: Used as rating conditions for air leakage for a building. The most common values used are 50 Pa or 75 Pa since they correspond to common rating conditions. For the model of actual building value this value would be measured but for created baseline or reference model this could be an assumed value.

is_measured_infiltration_based_on_test.description: Indicates whether the differential pressure difference used during measurement for infiltration values is based on pressure testing of the building.

fluid_loops.notes: Contains a list of fluid loops on the site.

service_water_heating_distribution_syste.description: Service water heating systems on the site
service_water_heating_distribution_syste.notes: Contains a list of service water heating distribution systems at the site.

service_water_heating_equipment.description: Service water heating equipment on the site
service_water_heating_equipment.notes: Contains a list of service water heating equipment at the site.

external_fluid_sources.notes: The sources of energy, such as district chilled water, district hot water, and district steam.

site_zone_type.notes: The site designation type for exterior lighting classification.

building_segments.notes: Contains a list of building segments in the building.

elevators.notes: Contains a list of elevators in the building.

exterior_lighting.notes: Contains a list of exterior lighting systems for the building.

refrigerated_cases.notes: Contains a list of refrigerated cases in the building.

building_open_schedule.description: Reference to the schedule indicating when the building is open
building_open_schedule.notes: One represent when the building is open and zero when closed. If the schedule is not present, 24 hour operation is assumed. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

has_site_shading.description: Indicates whether the site has features that cast shadows on the building

number_of_floors_above_grade.notes: For the entire building including all building segments. Includes only floors that are not devoted solely to parking or unconditioned space.

number_of_floors_below_grade.notes: For the entire building including all building segments. Includes only floors that are not devoted solely to parking or unconditioned space.

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer

number_of_floors_above_grade.notes: For the portion of the building represented by the BuildingSegment.

number_of_floors_below_grade.notes: For the portion of the building represented by the BuildingSegment.

is_all_new.description: Indicates whether the building segment is completely new construction (true) or existing (false).
is_all_new.notes: Projects that include additions should have a building segments that are existing (false) and for the addition (true). Curtain rules such as baseline fenestration area will apply differently to each portion.

zones.notes: Contains a list of zones in the building.

heating_ventilating_air_conditioning_sys.description: HVAC systems in the building segment
heating_ventilating_air_conditioning_sys.notes: Contains a list of HVAC systems in the building.

area_type_vertical_fenestration.description: Building area classification used for vertical fenestration
area_type_vertical_fenestration.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

lighting_building_area_type.notes: The lighting building area type for the building segment. If used, options are provided in the ruleset specific enumerations. This data element may also be used for determining the building area type for other purposes such as target setting targets (like 90.1 building performanc factors) so it should be completed even when the lighting building area method is not used.

area_type_heating_ventilating_air_condit.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group
id.notes: No multipliers or floor multipliers are used with the Zone data group so each zone should be individually identified.

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

spaces.notes: Contains a list of spaces in the building.

floor_name.notes: Used to group zones on a floor. Zones with the same floor name are on the same floor. Numbers may be used as part of the floor name such as Level 1. If a number is used it should increase for increasing heights and use negative values for stories generally below ground. The floor name should generally correspond to numbering of floors on the plans.

surfaces.notes: Contains a list of surfaces that define the zone.

infiltration.notes: References a single infiltration data group. If a zone includes multiple spaces and infiltration is specified at the space level the rates and schedules should be aggregated to the zone.

design_thermostat_cooling_setpoint.description: Setpoint temperature for cooling during occupied hours
design_thermostat_cooling_setpoint.notes: The cooling setpoint temperature for the zone at design conditions.

thermostat_cooling_setpoint_schedule.description: Reference to the schedule containing the cooling setpoint temperatures
thermostat_cooling_setpoint_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the design thermostat cooling setpoint is assumed to be constant. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

design_thermostat_heating_setpoint.description: Setpoint temperature for heating during occupied hours
design_thermostat_heating_setpoint.notes: The heating setpoint temperature for the zone at design conditions.

thermostat_heating_setpoint_schedule.description: Reference to the schedule containing the heating setpoint temperatures
thermostat_heating_setpoint_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the design thermostat heating setpoint is assumed to be constant. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

minimum_humidity_setpoint_schedule.description: Reference to the schedule containing the minimum relative humidity setpoint
minimum_humidity_setpoint_schedule.notes: For schedule values use relative humidity expressed on a 0 to 1 scale. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

maximum_humidity_setpoint_schedule.description: Reference to the schedule containing the maximum relative humidity setpoint
maximum_humidity_setpoint_schedule.notes: For schedule values use relative humidity expressed on a 0 to 1 scale. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

terminals.notes: Multiple terminals may be used such as from a VAV system, a DOAS, and a baseboard.

served_by_service_water_heating_system.description: A service water heating system serving the zone
served_by_service_water_heating_system.notes: Contains a single ID of the service water heating system serving the zone - from Unique Identification Number in ServiceWaterHeatingSystem. Constraint to use when implemented :ServiceWaterHeatingDistributionSystem:

transfer_airflow_rate.notes: Net transfer air. Positive values indicate transfer air in to the zone and negative values show transfer out of the zone.

transfer_airflow_source_zone.description: ID of the source zone for transfer air.

zonal_exhaust_fan.notes: References a fan that is used to exhaust air from the zone. The fan should be configured to not be connected from any other HVAC data group.

exhaust_airflow_rate_multiplier_schedule.description: Reference to the schedule containing the multiplier for the exhaust airflow rate
exhaust_airflow_rate_multiplier_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the multiplier is always one. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

non_mechanical_cooling_fan_power.notes: The power consumed by a fan used in a non-mechancial cooling device such as a ceiling fan.

non_mechanical_cooling_fan_airflow.notes: The airflow of a fan used in a non-mechancial cooling device such as a ceiling fan.

aggregation_factor.notes: A factor that has already been applied when modeling a zone that represents an aggregation of several individual zones shown on design documents. For example, if five dwelling units facing the same orientation are modeled as a single zone, the total volume of the zone and the total surface area of the zone should be five times the values of a single dwelling unit shown on the design documents and aggregation_factor should be set to 5. Another example, when three identical floors are modeled, the zones modeled for these floors should represent the volume of the zone on three floors, and the aggregation_factor should be set to 3. A final example would be a big box retail store with eight units serving the core zone, the total floor area of the spaces in the core zone should already account for the total area, and the aggregation_factor should be set to 8. The factor is chiefly used to determine the size range for heating and cooling equipment serving that zone. Used only to confirm the individual size of heating or cooling units serving the zone so that the efficiency for that size range can be looked up in tables of equipment efficiency by size range. By dividing the heating and cooling capacity of the zone by the aggregation_factor, the result would indicate the capacity of the individual units represented by equipment. For zones not representing any type of aggregation, this value should be one. The aggregation_factor is typically an integer but occasionally may include a fractional value. The total area of the spaces and the volume of the zone should already be multiplied by the factor.

interior_lighting.description: Internal lighting that produce internal gains for a space.
interior_lighting.notes: References one or more InteriorLighting data groups that collectively define all interior lighting within the space.

miscellaneous_equipment.description: Miscellaneous equipment loads that produce internal gains for a space.
miscellaneous_equipment.notes: References one or more MiscellaneousEquipment that collectively describe all of the miscellaneous equipment in the space.

floor_area.description: The floor area of the space.
floor_area.notes: The floor area of a space within the building, including basements, mezzanine and intermediate-floored tiers, and penthouses with a headroom height of 7.5 ft or greater. It is measured from the exterior faces of walls or from the center-line of walls separating buildings, but excluding covered walkways, open roofed-over areas, porches and similar spaces, pipe trenches, exterior terraces or steps, chimneys, roof overhangs, and similar features. This is the floor area that is modeled.

number_of_occupants.description: Number of occupants in the space

occupant_multiplier_schedule.description: Reference to the schedule containing the multiplier for the number of occupants
occupant_multiplier_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the multiplier is always one. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

occupant_sensible_heat_gain.description: Sensible heat gain of each occupant.

occupant_latent_heat_gain.description: Latent heat gain of each occupant.

status_type.description: Choice of new, existing, addition, alteration, etc.

function.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

envelope_space_type.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used. Often refered to as occupancy type.

lighting_space_type.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

ventilation_space_type.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

service_water_heating_space_type.description: Service water heating space type classification
service_water_heating_space_type.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

service_water_heating_uses.description: List of service water heating uses

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

modeling_method.description: The software methodology chosen for modeling infiltration

algorithm_name.description: Name of the algorithm used for modeling infiltration in the specific simulation engine.

measured_air_leakage_rate.description: Meaured air leakage rate from infiltration of outside air
measured_air_leakage_rate.notes: Based on the pressure described in ASHRAE229.measured_infiltration_pressure_difference. If a zone includes multiple spaces and infiltration is specified at the space level the rates should be aggregated to the zone.

flow_rate.notes: Infiltration flow rate for simulation infiltration models unadjusted for temperature difference or windspeed or schedule often with a windspeed at 10 mph (4.5 m/s).  This may vary in meaning between simulation engines. If a zone includes multiple spaces and infiltration is specified at the space level the rates should be aggregated to the zone.

multiplier_schedule.description: Referenced to the schedule containing the multiplier for the infiltration
multiplier_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the multiplier is always one. If a zone includes multiple spaces and infiltration is specified at the space level the rates and schedules should be aggregated to the zone. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

descriptions: Weather Driven. The amount of air leakage is determined by using the infiltration_flow_rate with a correlation usually involving windspeed, height, and the difference between indoor and outdoor temperature and is then multiplied by the schedule.
Pressure Based. The amount of air leakage is determined by induced airflows from pressure differences between zones, air distribution system components, the outside due to wind speed and direction.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

subsurfaces.description: Suburfaces that are on the surface
subsurfaces.notes: Contains a list of surfaces that define the space.

classification.notes: Options for surface being interior or exterior wall, floor, or ceiling.

area.notes: Measured from interior face area. It is the gross area of the wall and includes the area of all subsurfaces.

tilt.description: Angle between vertical and the surface outward normal
tilt.notes: Example value would be 0 = roof, 90 = wall, 180 = downward facing surface (exterior floor)

azimuth.description: Clockwise angle between North and the horizontal projection of the wall's outward normal.
azimuth.notes: Example values would be 0 = north, 90 = East, 180 = South, 270 = West. For rulesets with baseline rotations, the angle of the azimuth should be different for each baseline rotation.

adjacent_to.description: Used to classify the conditions on the surface.
adjacent_to.notes: Determines whether the other side of the surface is modeled and if not what assumptions should be used. Commonly, plenums do not need to be explicitly described for many rulesets and instead when a plenum is present in the simulation model, this field should be set to the what is adjacent to the other side of the plenum. For example, on the top floor with a plenum, EXTERIOR would be entered.

adjacent_zone.description: ID of the adjacent zone for interior surface. Only required when adjacent zone is explicity modeled when adjacent_to is set to INTERIOR.

does_cast_shade.description: Determines whether the surface is modeled as casting shade on other exterior surfaces

status_type.description: Choice of new, existing, addition, alteration, etc. for each ruleset.

id.description: Scope-unique reference identifier for instances of this data group

reporting_name.description: Descriptive name used in RCT reports if id is not already a descriptive name

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

classification.description: Classification for the subsurface being window, skylight, door.

surface_construction_input_option.description: Identifies whether construction is entered layer-by-layer or simplified (R-value)

fraction_framing.description: Fraction of the construction that is framing.
fraction_framing.notes: Fraction of the construction using framing_layers, the remaining portion uses the primary_layers. If blank, assume zero framing.

primary_layers.description: List of names of layer descriptions starting from the outside surface for primary heat path
primary_layers.notes: For constructions with framing and cavity heat transfer paths, use this for the cavity. For constructions with homogeneous layer, use this element only. Air films should not be included in the list of layers.

framing_layers.description: List of names of layer descriptions starting from the outside surface for the framing heat path
framing_layers.notes: For constructions with framing and cavity heat transfer paths, use this for the framing otherwise leave blank. Air films should not be included in the list of layers.

insulation_locations.description: List of locations for the insulation related to the surface that correspoond to the values in the r_values list

u_factor.notes: Includes interior and exterior air films as specified by the referenced standard.

c_factor.notes: Typically used to describe the thermal perfromance of constructions used in below grade walls. It is the time rate of steady-state heat flow through unit area of a material or construction, induced by a unit temperature difference between the body surfaces. Note that the C-factor does not include soil or air films.

f_factor.notes: Typically used to describe the thermal perfromance of constructions used in slab-on-grade floors. It is the heat transfer through the floor, induced by a unit temperature difference between the outside and inside air temperature, on the per linear length of the exposed perimeter of the floor.

r_values.description: List of r-value of the insulation for the surface that correspond to values in the insulation_locations list

descriptions: Continous insulation on exterior of an above ground wall
Continous insulation on interior of an above ground wall
Insulation within the cavity of an above ground wall that fills the entire cavity
Insulation within the cavity of an above ground wall that fills only part of the cavity
Insulation on underside of the slab covering the perimeter
Insulation fully covering the underside of the slab
Insulation applied vertically next to edge of slab

thickness.description: The thickness of the material layer

thermal_conductivity.description: The thermal conductivity of the material layer
thermal_conductivity.notes: When thermal_conductivity is specified, r_value should not be provided.

density.description: The density of the material layer

specific_heat.description: The specific heat of the material layer

r_value.description: r-value of the insulation for the material layer
r_value.notes: When r_value is specified, thermal_conductivity should not be provided. Typically used for insulation or air gaps.

notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

absorptance_thermal_exterior.description: Thermal absorptance of long wavelength radiation on the exterior surface.
absorptance_thermal_exterior.notes: May also be called thermal emittance, emittance or emissivity and represents the fraction of incident long wavelength radiation that is absorbed by the material

absorptance_solar_exterior.description: Thermal absorptance of short wavelength radiation on the exterior surface.
absorptance_solar_exterior.notes: Equals one minus the solar reflectance (for opaque materials) and represents the fraction of incident solar radiation that is absorbed by the material

absorptance_visible_exterior.description: Thermal absorptance of visible radiation on the exterior surface.
absorptance_visible_exterior.notes: Equals one minus the visible reflectance (for opaque materials) and represents the fraction of incident visible wavelength radiation that is absorbed by the material

absorptance_thermal_interior.description: Thermal absorptance of long wavelength radiation on the interior surface.
absorptance_thermal_interior.notes: May also be called thermal emittance, emittance or emissivity and represents the fraction of incident long wavelength radiation that is absorbed by the material

absorptance_solar_interior.description: Thermal absorptance of short wavelength radiation on the interior surface.
absorptance_solar_interior.notes: Equals one minus the solar reflectance (for opaque materials) and represents the fraction of incident solar radiation that is absorbed by the material

absorptance_visible_interior.description: Thermal absorptance of visible radiation on the interior surface.
absorptance_visible_interior.notes: Equals one minus the visible reflectance (for opaque materials) and represents the fraction of incident visible wavelength radiation that is absorbed by the material

descriptions: Exterior wall or roof which is adjacent to the exterior environment.
Slab-on-grad or below grade surface if adjacent to ground.
Interior surface if adjacent to another space which is explicity modeled.

Surface adjacent to a environment identical to the space. Sometimes this is described as adiabatic surface since no heat is transfered. The space on the other side of the surface is not explicity modeled.
The surface adjacency cannot be determined by the software.
Construction is entered by R-value only.

classification.description: Classification for the subsurface being window, skylight, door.

is_operable.notes: This applies to windows and skylights but not to doors.

has_open_sensor.description: Has sensor and reports to building control system when the window or door is open.

framing_type.notes: This applies to windows and skylights but not to doors.

glazed_area.description: Area of subsurface including glass and transparent surfaces

opaque_area.description: Area of subsurface framing for a window or skylight or opaque portion for a door.

u_factor.notes: Includes interior and exterior air films as specified by the referenced standard.

dynamic_glazing_type.description: Type of dynamic glazing for the window subsurface
dynamic_glazing_type.notes: Indicates if the glazed subsurface can change it's performance properties and if it is automatic or not.

solar_heat_gain_coefficient.notes: For dynamic glazing represents the minimum SHGC

maximum_solar_heat_gain_coefficient.description: Maximum Subsurface SHGC for Dynamic Glazing

visible_transmittance.notes: For dynamic glazing represents the maximum visible transmittance

minimum_visible_transmittance.description: Minimum Subsurface VT for Dynamic Glazing

depth_of_overhang.description: Distance from the edge of the overhang to the subsurface.

has_manual_interior_shades.description: Are there manually-operated interior shading such as blinds, curtains or shades

solar_transmittance_multiplier_summer.notes: Often used to account for interior shading such as drapes.

solar_transmittance_multiplier_winter.notes: Often used to account for interior shading such as drapes.

has_automatic_shades.description: Are there automatic interior shading such as blinds, curtains or shades

status_type.description: Choice of new, existing, addition, alteration, etc. for each ruleset.

descriptions: Other types of subsurfaces that allow light to pass

power_per_area.description: Total power for lights divided by the area of the space.
power_per_area.notes: When computing the power per area use the area of the entire space.

lighting_multiplier_schedule.description: Reference to the schedule containing the multiplier for lighting
lighting_multiplier_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the multiplier is always one. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

occupancy_control_type.description: Indicates the type of occupancy controls

daylighting_control_type.description: Indicates the type of daylighting controls

are_schedules_used_for_modeling_occupanc.description: Indicates that schedule values are used for modeling the impacts of occupancy controls on lighting.

are_schedules_used_for_modeling_daylight.description: Indicates that schedule values are used for modeling the impacts of daylighting controls on lighting.
are_schedules_used_for_modeling_daylight.notes: For simulations that are modeling daylighting by computing the illumance this should be false.

notes: No daylighting is used.
No occupancy controls is used.

notes.description: Supplementary information to provide context to the model reviewer
notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

energy_type.description: Source of energy for the miscellaneous equipment in the space
energy_type.notes: To indicate that the energy is not accounted for by any utility supplied source, choose NONE. To indicate equipment with a energy source from a Loop choose OTHER

power.description: Power for miscellaneous equipment in the space
power.notes: The value of power for the miscellaneous equipment in the space that when multiplied by the schedule is the consumption of power (for electricity or other energy_type's) for each period in the schedule.

multiplier_schedule.description: Reference to the schedule containing the multiplier for miscellaneous equipment power in the space.
multiplier_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the multiplier is always one. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

sensible_fraction.description: Fraction of energy that is a sensible load on the space.
sensible_fraction.notes: Sensible plus latent do not necessarily add up to 1.0.

latent_fraction.description: Fraction of energy that is a latent load on the space.
latent_fraction.notes: Sensible plus latent do not necessarily add up to 1.0.

remaining_fraction_to_loop.description: Referenced to the water fluid loop for the remaining fraction
remaining_fraction_to_loop.notes: If sensible_fraction and latent_fraction add up to less than 1.0 and this field is specified then the chilled water or condenser water loop specified gets the remaining fraction of the miscellenous load. Constraint to use when implemented :FluidLoop:

energy_from_loop.description: Referenced to the loop serving as the source of energy
energy_from_loop.notes: References the loop that is the source of energy for the miscellenous equipment. Example would be hot water that is used for laundry in the zone. When this is used the energy_type should be set to OTHER. Constraint to use when implemented :FluidLoop:

has_automatic_control.description: Indicates that the receptacles have automatic controls

hourly_values.notes: Used when schedule_sequence_type is HOURLY. Can also use functions like EFLH(), MAX(), MIN() to determine overall characteristics for the list of schedule values.

hourly_heating_design_day.description: Hourly values for heating design day

hourly_cooling_design_day.description: Hourly values for cooling design day

event_times.description: Event times when the schedule changes
event_times.notes: Used when schedule_sequence_type is EVENT to describe the time of the year in seconds that the schedule changes value.

event_values.description: Event value at corresponding event time.
event_values.notes: Used when schedule_sequence_type is EVENT. New values starting at corresponding to the event time until following event time minus one second. Can also use functions like EFLH(), MAX(), MIN() to determine overall characteristics for the list of schedule values.

event_times_heating_design_day.description: Event times when the schedule changes for heating design day

event_values_heating_design_day.description: Event value at corresponding event time for heating design day
event_values_heating_design_day.notes: Used when schedule_sequence_type is EVENT. New values starting at corresponding to the event time until following event time minus one second.

event_times_cooling_design_day.description: Event times when the schedule changes for cooling design day

event_values_cooling_design_day.description: Event value at corresponding event time for cooling design day
event_values_cooling_design_day.notes: Used when schedule_sequence_type is EVENT. New values starting at corresponding to the event time until following event time minus one second.

type.notes: Primarily indicates if the values may be represented by units such as C for temperature or W for power or m3/s for flow rate or are dimensionless multipliers.

prescribed_type.description: Options when any schedule values have changed from what appears in the schedule library
prescribed_type.notes: Some rule sets prescribe which schedules to use for modeling purposes. This option indicates if the schedule is as prescribed or has been modified.

is_modified_for_workaround.description: True if any schedule has been modified for a workaround
is_modified_for_workaround.notes: Not all technologies can be modeled directly in the simulation program.  Modifiying schedules is a common workaround for modeling some technologies.  This flag is used to indicate when a schedule has been modified for this purpose.

day_of_week_for_january_1.description: Day of the week for January 1

is_leap_year.description: The schedules assume it is a leap year
is_leap_year.notes: This value is true if the calendar and schedules include February 29.

has_daylight_saving_time.description: The schedules adjust for Daylight Saving Time
has_daylight_saving_time.notes: This value should be true if the modeled calendar includes daylight saving time.

data_source_type.description: Data source use for the weather file.

climate_zone.description: The designation of the climate zone where the building is located
climate_zone.notes: The enumeration is based on the standard used.

cooling_design_day_type.description: The frequency of occurance type for cooling design day

heating_design_day_type.description: The frequency of occurance type for heating design day

cab_heat_fraction.notes: When specified, it is the fraction of the heat from the cab that gets added to the zone including lighting heat, fan heat, and accessory heat

cab_motor_multiplier_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the multiplier is always one. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

cab_ventilation_fan_multiplier_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the multiplier is always one. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

cab_lighting_multiplier_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the multiplier is always one. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

fan_system.notes: One FanSystem for each HeatingVentilatingAirConditioningSystem so if a direct outdoor air system is used a second Zone Terminal should be specified with a separate HeatingVentilatingAirConditioningSystem.

heating_system.notes: References the HeatingSystem data group that acts as the main heating system or coil for this HVAC System.  If the HVAC system does not have a heating system, this entry can be left blank, or the HeatingSystem HeatingSystemOptions can be set to equal NONE.

cooling_system.notes: References the CoolingSystem data group associated with this HVAC System.  If the HVAC system does not have a cooling system, this entry can be left blank, or the CoolingSystem CoolingSystemOptions can be set to equal NONE.

preheat_system.notes: References a HeatingSystem data group that provides preheat to this HVAC System. Preheat is typically a coil used to temper cold air entering an HVAC systm often when high quantities of outdoor air is expected. If the HVAC system does not have a preheat system, this entry can be left blank, or the HeatingSystem HeatingSystemOptions can be set to equal NONE in the referenced data group.

type.notes: System configurations that typically are at the zone and include a compressor (such as packaged terminal air conditioning, packaged terminal heat pumps, window air conditioning units, and water loop heat pumps) should be reported in the schema using HeatingSystem and CoolingSystem. Systems that include gas or electric furnaces should be reported in the schema using HeatingSystem. System configurations that are at the zone and only include fans and coils (such as four-pipe fan coil, two-pipe fan coil, radiant systems, baseboards, and chilled beams) should be reported in the schema using Terminal with the chilled water and hot water systems described in the cooling_source and heating_source data elements (and any other relevant Terminal Data elements). Evaporative cooling systems should be described in CoolingSystem. Passive diffusers with no coil or fan should be described in Terminal.

energy_source_type.description: Source of energy for the heating system

hot_water_loop.description: Referenced to the hot water fluid loop

water_source_heat_pump_loop.description: Referenced to the water fluid loop to support water source heat pumps

design_capacity.notes: Design capacity may be determined by sizing performed by the software.  This value should be provided if sized by the simulation software as an output or explicitly provided as a simulation input.

rated_capacity.notes: At rating conditions. The rated capacity is generally used to determine efficiency level when efficiency level is based on size. It is net heating capacity taking into account the heat from the indoor fan.

oversizing_factor.description: The oversizing factor applied to the peak load that results in the heat capacity. Zero indicates no oversizing.
oversizing_factor.notes: Used for furnace or heat pump.

is_sized_based_on_design_day.description: True if the component is sized by the simulation software for the design day

heating_coil_setpoint.description: Setpoint of the air leaving the heating coil
heating_coil_setpoint.notes: The setpoint of the air leaving the heating coil at design conditions.

efficiency_metric_values.description: List of efficiency metric values that correspond to the descriptors in efficiency_metric_types list
efficiency_metric_values.notes: Used for furnace or heat pump.

efficiency_metric_types.description: List of efficiency metrics that correspond to the values in efficiency_metric_values list
efficiency_metric_types.notes: Used for furnace or heat pump.

heatpump_auxilliary_heat_type.description: Heatpump auxilliary heat type used for backup

heatpump_auxilliary_heat_high_shutoff_te.description: Heatpump auxilliary heat high temperature shutoff

Efficiency at -8.3C/17F dry bulb and -9.4C/15F wet bulb
Efficiency at 8.3C/47F dry bulb and 6.1C/43F wet bulb not including fan
Efficiency at -8.3C/17F dry bulb and -9.4C/15F wet bulb not including fan

design_sensible_cool_capacity.notes: Designed sensible cooling capacity. Design sensible capacity may be determined by sizing performed by the software. This value should be provided if sized by the simulation as an output or explicitly provided as a simulation input.

rated_sensible_cool_capacity.notes: At rating conditions. The rated capacity is generally used to determine efficiency level when efficiency level is based on size.  It is net sensible cooling capacity taking into account the heat from the indoor fan.

notes.notes: Notes are not used by the RCT, but may be included in RCT reports to give the reviewer additional information or context

supply_fans.notes: List of fans that supply air by the HVAC system and are located in the building.

return_fans.notes: List of fans that return air to the HVAC system and are located in the building.

exhaust_fans.notes: List of fans that exhaust air from the building either at the air handler or located in various spaces. The fans are located in the building.

relief_fans.notes: List of fans that exhaust air from the building at the air handler to maintain proper pressurization. The fans are located in the building.

air_economizer.description: Air side economizer related to the fan system

air_energy_recovery.description: Air side energy recovery related to the fan system

has_lock_out_central_heat_during_unoccup.description: Locks out the use of central heating during unoccupied hours
has_lock_out_central_heat_during_unoccup.notes: Typically used when zone has heating coil available that can serve unoccupied heating load.

reset_differential_temperature.description: Supply air temperature reset differential temperature at minimum cooling load
reset_differential_temperature.notes: When temperature_control is LOAD_RESET_TO_SPACE_TEMPERATURE this temperate is added to the supply air temperature at minimum cooling load conditions. When temperature_control is LOAD_RESET_DIFFERENTIAL_TEMPERATURE this temperate is the temperate below space tempature when no cooling load. The supply air temperature is specified in Terminal.

supply_air_temperature_reset_load_fracti.description: Supply air temperature reset load fraction
supply_air_temperature_reset_load_fracti.notes: When temperature_control is LOAD_RESET_TO_SPACE_TEMPERATURE, this is the threshold fraction below which supply air temperature reset begins.  Between the stated load fraction and 0% load the supply air temperature is ramped linearally until the supply air temperature reaches the zone. The supply air temperature is specified in Terminal.

supply_air_temperature_reset_schedule.notes: The supply air temperature is specified in Terminal. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

fan_volume_reset_fraction.notes: When fan_volume_reset_type is DESIGN_LOAD_RESET this is the fraction of the design load that corresponds to minimum air flow. When fan_volume_reset_type is OPERATING_CAPACITY_RESET this is the fraction of the instanteous operating capacity that corresponds to minimum air flow.

operating_schedule.notes: If the schedule is not present, the fansystem  is always operating. Zero when fan is off. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

minimum_airflow.notes: The minimum airflow may be determined by sizing performed by the softare. This value should be provided if sized by the simulation software as an output or explicitly provided as a simulation input.

minimum_outdoor_airflow.notes: If the minimum_outdoor_airflow is equal to the maximum_outdoor_airflow and equal to the total supply fan volume that indicates a constant volume dedicated outdoor air system. If only the  maximum_outdoor_airflow and equal to the total supply fan volume but the minimum_outdoor_airflow is lower that indicates an air side economizer.

maximum_outdoor_airflow.notes: If the minimum_outdoor_airflow is equal to the maximum_outdoor_airflow and equal to the total supply fan volume that indicates a constant volume dedicated outdoor air system. If only the  maximum_outdoor_airflow and equal to the total supply fan volume but the minimum_outdoor_airflow is lower that indicates an air side economizer.

air_filter_merv_rating.description: The MERV rating of the air filter

has_fully_ducted_return.description: If the fan system has fully ducted return.

is_integrated.notes: When the economizer is integrated with the mechanical cooling system it is capable of providing partial cooling even when additional mechanical cooling is required to meet the remainder of the cooling load.

specification_method.description: Options for how the fan is specified
specification_method.notes: Indicates if the fan is specified using the SIMPLE method of just the design electric power or using the DETAILED method of using pressure rise, nameplate power, shaft power, total efficiency, and motor efficiency.

design_electric_power.notes: Only used when specification_method is set to Simple.

design_pressure_rise.description: Pressure rise through fan at design flow conditions
design_pressure_rise.notes: Only used when specification_method is set to Detailed

motor_nameplate_power.notes: Only used when specification_method is set to Detailed.

shaft_power.notes: Power delivered to the fanÂ’s shaft and does not include the mechanical drive losses. Equivalent to fan brake horsepower for inch-pound units. Only used when specification_method is set to Detailed.

total_efficiency.notes: Only used when specification_method is set to Detailed. It includes the overall efficiency of the combination of the fan, drive, and motor.

motor_efficiency.notes: Only used when specification_method is set to Detailed.

motor_heat_to_airflow_fraction.description: Fraction of motor heat added to the airflow.
motor_heat_to_airflow_fraction.notes: Fraction to airflow plus fraction to zone do not necessarily add up to 1.0.

motor_heat_to_zone_fraction.description: Fraction of motor heat added to the zone.
motor_heat_to_zone_fraction.notes: Fraction to airflow plus fraction to zone do not necessarily add up to 1.0.

motor_location_zone.description: Zone where the heat from the motor goes
motor_location_zone.notes: When specified, it is the zone the heat from the fan motor get added to. Constraint to use when implemented :Zone:

status_type.description: Choice of new, existing, addition, alteration, etc. for each ruleset.

output_validation_points.notes: Airflow is input to each validation point and energy output is the result. A minimum number of four points is recommended. Certain rulesets may have a different minimum number of points. For example, 90.1 Appendix G expects 11 data points.

airflow.notes: No name and id is needed since typically used as one of a series.

result.notes: The rate of energy used by the fan at the given airflow.

notes: Specify the electric power input of fan
Specify the brake horse power, design pressure rise through, total efficiency, motor efficiency

Evaporative cooling systems should be described in CoolingSystem. Passive diffusers with no coil or fan should be described in Terminal.

heating_source.notes: Used for terminal heating including reheat.

heating_from_loop.description: References the fluid loop used to provide heating
heating_from_loop.notes: Only used when heating_source is hot water. Used for terminal heating including reheat. Constraint to use when implemented :FluidLoop:

cooling_from_loop.description: Referenced the fluid loop used to provide cooling
cooling_from_loop.notes: Only used when cooling_source is chilled water. Used for terminal cooling including radiant and fan coils. Constraint to use when implemented :FluidLoop:

fan.notes: The fan data group associated with the terminal.  If no fan is modeled for this terminal, this field should be left blank.

primary_airflow.notes: Zone terminal primary airflow at design conditions.

max_heating_airflow.notes: Entry only needed if maximum heating airflow is different than the pimary airflow such as when describing a dual maximum VAV box control.

supply_design_heating_setpoint_temperatu.description: Zone terminal supply design heating temperature setpoint

supply_design_cooling_setpoint_temperatu.description: Zone terminal supply design cooling temperature setpoint

minimum_outdoor_airflow.description: Zone terminal minimum outdoor air volume airflow
minimum_outdoor_airflow.notes: This value should be provided if fan airflow determined by sizing performed by the software or explicitly provided.

minimum_outdoor_airflow_multiplier_sched.description: Zone terminal minimum outdoor air volume airflow multiplier schedule name
minimum_outdoor_airflow_multiplier_sched.notes: If the schedule is not present, the multiplier is always one. Constraint to use when implemented :Schedule:

heating_capacity.description: Heating capacity for baseboard or radiant system or reheat
heating_capacity.notes: Only includes the heating capacity of the terminal for hot water or electric coil. This value should be provided if determined by sizing performed by the software or explicitly provided.

cooling_capacity.description: Cooling capacity for the radiant system or cooling coil
cooling_capacity.notes: Only includes the cooling capacity of the terminal for chilled water coil for radiant or fan coil.  This value should be provided if determined by sizing performed by the software or explicitly provided.

is_supply_ducted.description: True if the the supply is ducted.
is_supply_ducted.notes: Packaged terminal air conditioners (PTAC), packaged terminal heat pumps (PTHP), and window or through the wall air conditioners should be False and other DX systems including rooftop units should be True

has_demand_control_ventilation.description: True if the zone has demand control ventilation
has_demand_control_ventilation.notes: The zone is either served by an air handler that responds to demand control ventilation signals from that zone or is served by a DOAS that specifically provides air to that zone on demand.

is_fan_first_stage_heat.description: True if the the only source of first stage heating is the heat from the fan itself
is_fan_first_stage_heat.notes: Only appropriate with variable volume boxes that are fan powered

heating_design_and_control.notes: References a FluidLoopDesignAndControl data group which describes how this FluidLoop is sized and controlled in heating mode.
